abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Recovery Grant Project of
            Malawi had the following ratings: outcomes were highly
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and
            borrower performance was highly satisfactory. The lessons
            learned included: 1) The Bank should consider whether direct
            disbursement, as is now carried out for development policy
            assistance, can be permitted for emergency assistance in
            certain circumstances - for example, where the adverse
            impact of macroeconomic disruption is likely to be severe
            but reversible within the existing policy framework; and 2)
            The Government and its partners should consider whether the
            macroeconomic effects of a future such emergency could be
            better provided for, either by targeting a larger build up
            of foreign exchange reserves, or by the development of
            better insurance instruments, like call options.

6379693.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Economic management

abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Recovery Grant Project
            will support the restoration of assets and production,
            following the drought-induced emergency in early 2005,
            through the financing of private sector imports necessary to
            an effective recovery program. The main objective will be to
            finance imports, critical to the recovery of investment and
            production; counterpart funds will be transferred to the
            approved budget, and thereby contribute to the financing of
            the Government's poverty reduction strategy. However,
            among the major risks is the impact of the crisis, which may
            be larger than anticipated, placing continued pressure on
            imports, such that investment, production, and exports may
            fail to recover quickly; that the next agricultural season
            may also be affected by adverse weather conditions which may
            undermine an economic recovery.
